RevenueSourceCategoryConfig.name: RevenueSourceCategoryConfig
RevenueSourceCategoryConfig.description: Represents the Revenue Data Source-related stage information and the revenue metric that you want to measure and track.

ClosedDateFieldName.description: The name of the field from Revenue Data Source that stores the opportunity close date.

ClosedLostStageOption.description: The options that represent the Closed Lost stage.

ClosedWonStageOption.description: The options that represent the Closed Won stage.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Record Type Name.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the category configurations are active (true) or not (false)

Language.description: The language of the revenue source category object.

MasterLabel.description: Label for the revenue source category configuration. In the UI, this field is Revenue Source Category Configuration.

RevenueDataSourceFieldName.description: The name of the field from Revenue Data Source that stores the revenue details as either amount or quantity.

RevenueDataSourceId.description: The revenue data source record associated with this record.

StageFieldName.description: The name of the field from Revenue Data Source that stores the stage picklist values.
